title: Greek, Turkish Cypriot leaders to meet April 16, first since peace talks collapse
text:
March 30, 2018 / 11:25 AM / Updated 12 minutes ago Greek, Turkish Cypriot leaders to meet April 16, first since peace talks collapse Reuters Staff 1 Min Read 
ATHENS (Reuters) - Leaders of Cyprusâ€™s two ethnically split communities have agreed to an informal meeting on April 16, the United Nations mission on the island said on Friday. FILE PHOTO - Cyprus' President Nicos Anastasiades delivers a speech during an investiture ceremony at the House of Representatives in Nicosia, Cyprus February 28, 2018. REUTERS/Yiannis Kourtoglou 
The meeting between Greek Cypriot leader Nicos Anastasiades and Turkish Cypriot leader Mustafa Akinci will be the first since United Nations led peace talks collapsed in acrimony in Switzerland in July 2017. Reporting By Michele Kambas
